member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlReader.MoveToContent
member.summary: Checks whether the current node is a content (non-white space text, CDATA, Element, EndElement, EntityReference, or EndEntity) node. If the node is not a content node, the reader skips ahead to the next content node or end of file. It skips over nodes of the following type: ProcessingInstruction, DocumentType, Comment, Whitespace, or SignificantWhitespace.
member.returns: The of the current node found by the method or XmlNodeType.None if the reader has reached the end of the input stream.
member.exception: Incorrect XML encountered in the input stream.
An method was called before a previous asynchronous operation finished. In this case, is thrown with the message “An asynchronous operation is already in progress.”

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlReader.MoveToContentAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously checks whether the current node is a content node. If the node is not a content node, the reader skips ahead to the next content node or end of file.

member.exception: An method was called before a previous asynchronous operation finished. In this case, is thrown with the message “An asynchronous operation is already in progress.”

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlWriter.WriteStartElement(System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes out a start tag with the specified local name.
member.param: The local name of the element.
member.exception: The writer is closed.

There is a character in the buffer that is a valid XML character but is not valid for the output encoding. For example, if the output encoding is ASCII, you should only use characters from the range of 0 to 127 for element and attribute names. The invalid character might be in the argument of this method or in an argument of previous methods that were writing to the buffer. Such characters are escaped by character entity references when possible (for example, in text nodes or attribute values). However, the character entity reference is not allowed in element and attribute names, comments, processing instructions, or CDATA sections.
An method was called before a previous asynchronous operation finished. In this case, is thrown with the message “An asynchronous operation is already in progress.”

member.name: T:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings
member.summary: Specifies a set of features to support on the object created by the method.

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.Async
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether asynchronous methods can be used on a particular instance.
member.returns: true if asynchronous methods can be used; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.CheckCharacters
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the XML writer should check to ensure that all characters in the document conform to the "2.2 Characters" section of the W3C XML 1.0 Recommendation.
member.returns: true to do character checking; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.Clone
member.summary: Creates a copy of the instance.
member.returns: The cloned object.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.CloseOutput
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the should also close the underlying stream or when the method is called.
member.returns: true to also close the underlying stream or ; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.ConformanceLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of conformance that the XML writer checks the XML output for.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values that specifies the level of conformance (document, fragment, or automatic detection). The default is .

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of text encoding to use.
member.returns: The text encoding to use. The default is Encoding.UTF8.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.Indent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to indent elements.
member.returns: true to write individual elements on new lines and indent; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.IndentChars
member.summary: Gets or sets the character string to use when indenting. This setting is used when the property is set to true.
member.returns: The character string to use when indenting. This can be set to any string value. However, to ensure valid XML, you should specify only valid white space characters, such as space characters, tabs, carriage returns, or line feeds. The default is two spaces.
member.exception: The value assigned to the is null.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.NamespaceHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the should remove duplicate namespace declarations when writing XML content. The default behavior is for the writer to output all namespace declarations that are present in the writer's namespace resolver.
member.returns: The enumeration used to specify whether to remove duplicate namespace declarations in the .

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.NewLineChars
member.summary: Gets or sets the character string to use for line breaks.
member.returns: The character string to use for line breaks. This can be set to any string value. However, to ensure valid XML, you should specify only valid white space characters, such as space characters, tabs, carriage returns, or line feeds. The default is \r\n (carriage return, new line).
member.exception: The value assigned to the is null.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.NewLineHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to normalize line breaks in the output.
member.returns: One of the values. The default is .

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.NewLineOnAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to write attributes on a new line.
member.returns: true to write attributes on individual lines; otherwise, false. The default is false.NoteThis setting has no effect when the property value is false.When is set to true, each attribute is pre-pended with a new line and one extra level of indentation.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.OmitXmlDeclaration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to omit an XML declaration.
member.returns: true to omit the XML declaration; otherwise, false. The default is false, an XML declaration is written.

member.name: M:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.Reset
member.summary: Resets the members of the settings class to their default values.

member.name: P:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.WriteEndDocumentOnClose
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the will add closing tags to all unclosed element tags when the method is called.
member.returns: true if all unclosed element tags will be closed out; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: T:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema

member.name: T:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaForm
member.summary: Indicates if attributes or elements need to be qualified with a namespace prefix.

member.name: F:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaForm.None
member.summary: Element and attribute form is not specified in the schema.

member.name: F:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaForm.Qualified
member.summary: Elements and attributes must be qualified with a namespace prefix.

member.name: F:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaForm.Unqualified
member.summary: Elements and attributes are not required to be qualified with a namespace prefix.

member.summary: Provides custom formatting for XML serialization and deserialization.

member.name: M:System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable.GetSchema
member.summary: This method is reserved and should not be used. When implementing the IXmlSerializable interface, you should return null (Nothing in Visual Basic) from this method, and instead, if specifying a custom schema is required, apply the to the class.
member.returns: An that describes the XML representation of the object that is produced by the method and consumed by the method.

member.name: P:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemaProviderAttribute.IsAny
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the target class is a wildcard, or that the schema for the class has contains only an xs:any element.
member.returns: true, if the class is a wildcard, or if the schema contains only the xs:any element; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemaProviderAttribute.MethodName
member.summary: Gets the name of the static method that supplies the type's XML schema and the name of its XML Schema data type.
member.returns: The name of the method that is invoked by the XML infrastructure to return an XML schema.
